meanings.definition: Bad or improper rule or government
meanings.sent1: The misrule of the kingdom led to chaos and unhappiness among the people.
meanings.sent2: The country suffered under the misrule of a corrupt leader.
meanings.sent3: The misrule in the land made even the simplest tasks difficult to accomplish.
meanings.sent4: Under the misrule of the tyrant, the once prosperous city fell into ruin.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of misrule were evident in the crumbling infrastructure and lack of basic services.

meanings.definition: Disorder or confusion caused by bad rule
meanings.sent1: The misrule in the classroom resulted in students not knowing what to do.
meanings.sent2: The misrule of the organization led to missed deadlines and misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The misrule at the party caused guests to bump into each other in confusion.
meanings.sent4: In the misrule of the traffic system, cars honked and swerved in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The misrule of the schedule left everyone unsure of when to arrive and when to leave.

meanings.definition: To rule or govern badly or improperly
meanings.sent1: The king's decision to misrule his people resulted in unrest and dissatisfaction.
meanings.sent2: The mayor's tendency to misrule the town led to protests and calls for change.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to misrule their make-believe kingdom with laughter and joy.
meanings.sent4: The coach warned the team not to misrule their positions on the field.
meanings.sent5: The dictator continued to misrule with an iron fist, ignoring the pleas for justice.
